sign_sequence.description: Index finger points to the signer's chest.
sign_sequence.cultural_notes: This is a very common and straightforward sign.

sign_sequence.description: This is often omitted in ASL as it is implied by context.  However, if used, a slight head nod or tilt can suffice.
sign_sequence.cultural_notes: Avoid over-signing.  Context is key in ASL.

sign_sequence.description: Dominant hand makes a loose 'C' shape and moves to gently touch the chest.  Some signers add a slight shaking motion.
sign_sequence.cultural_notes: The intensity of the movement and expression on the face will affect the nuance of the sign.  A gentler movement might indicate affection, while a more forceful movement could signify stronger romantic love. Facial expression is critical for conveying emotion in ASL.
